Name: Vase of Mesehti
Description: The small beautiful vase of Mesehti, Mayor of Asiut, has a wide rim and a flat bottom. The vase may have been beaten into shape from a single sheet of copper. The thickness of the copper is almost uniform, but may be somewhat thicker at the base. The vase was finely polished and no marks from tools are visible on the entire surface. It was included with the funerary equipment, which suggests that it may have been used for funerary rituals.
